title: Notes and Commentary
html:
Isaiah 27: A chiastic pattern

The entire twenty-seventh chapter of Isaiah is structured into a neat chiasmus that is more easily recognized in the Hebrew but is also clear in the following English outline:

A. In that day the Lord will conquer Satan (v. 1)

B. The house of Israel (vineyard) is sung about (2)

C. The Lord watches over the people (3)

D. The Lord consumes his enemies with fire (4)

E. The strength and friendship of the Lord for his followers (5)

F. Jacob will grow and prosper (6)

G. Israel has not suffered as much as her oppressor (7-8)

F'. Jacob will be purged (9)

E'. The strength and power of the Lord against his enemies (9)

D'. Animals consume the branches and women make fires with them (10-11)

C'. The Lord knows the people lack understanding (or obedience; see Job 28:28) (11)

B'. The house of Israel gathered one by one (12)

A'. In that day the righteous will worship the Lord together (13)
